| Origin                  = The '''Skrull Army'''  is the ground force of the [[Deviant Skrulls]].{{r|Secret Invasion Vol 1 1}}
| Reality                 = 616
| Status                  = Active
| BaseOfOperations        = [[Tarnax II]]; formerly [[Skrullos]], [[Tarnax IV]], [[Satriani]]
| PlaceOfFormation        = 
| PlaceOfDissolution      = 

| Creators                = 
| First                   = Secret Invasion Vol 1 1

| Overview            = The Skrull armies are the ground forces of the Skrull Empire.{{r|Secret Invasion Vol 1 1}} Which is tasked with seizing and occupying worlds, as well as the defense of Skrull worlds from invaders and the liberation of occupied Skrull worlds.{{r|Secret Invasion Vol 1 1|8}}{{r|Annihilation: Super-Skrull Vol 1 1}}{{r|Avengers Vol 5 18}}{{r|Infinity Vol 1 5}} Skrull ground forces are transported to alien worlds by the [[Skrull Imperial Starfleet (Earth-616)|Skrull Armada]].{{r|Secret Invasion Vol 1 1|8}} The supreme commander of the armies is the emperor (or empress) of the Skrull Empire. When the Skrull empire is fragmented, the various armies are controlled by the warlords.{{r|Avengers Vol 5 18}} 
[[File:Skrull_Army_from_Captain_Britain_and_MI-13_Vol_1_3.png|250px|thumb]]
Skrull armies have a wide variety of ground vehicles and air support craft, armed with directed energy weapons. Which include anti-gravity vehicles, tracked vehicles, wheeled vehicles, bipedal and multi-legged mecha, and thrust engine air vehicles.{{r|Captain Britain and MI-13 Vol 1 1|4}}{{r|X-Men Vol 3 29}}{{r|Fantastic Four Vol 1 382}}{{r|Secret Invasion: X-Men Vol 1 1|3}} It is supported by various types of artillery, including gun platforms, beam cannon emplacements, anti-aircraft artillery, and ground-to-space cannons.{{r|Secret Invasion: X-Men 2}}{{r|Annihilation: Super-Skrull Vol 1 1}}{{r|Captain Marvel Vol 4 10}} They possess armored vehicles that are two stories high and dozens of ft long and multi-story tall mecha.{{r|Captain Britain and MI-13 Vol 1 1|4}}{{r|Secret Invasion: X-Men Vol 1 1|3}}{{r|X-Men Vol 3 29}} Weapon systems which are capable of killing Terran gods (e.g. the Celtic goddess, the [[Niamh Chinn Óir (Earth-616)|Lady of the Lake]]).{{r|Captain Britain and MI-13 Vol 1 2}} It is likely that they also have aquatic vessels or maritime naval support, and guided weapons (e.g. missiles).

Soldiers are armed with a variety of infantry-type weapons, including sidearms, rifles, gatling-type multi-barrel man-portable guns, and large-caliber man-portable cannons.{{r|Annihilation: Super-Skrull Vol 1 1}}{{r|Secret Invasion: X-Men Vol 1 1|3}}{{r|Captain Britain and MI-13 Vol 1 1|4}} Officers and a minority of the combat units (likely elite) may be protected by heavy armor which may be outfitted with helmets equipped with sensors, optics, etc.{{r|Secret Invasion: X-Men Vol 1 3}}{{r|Avengers Vol 5 18}} Soldiers also receive training in hand-to-hand combat and in the use of melee weapons (e.g. polearms and swords).{{r|Black Panther Vol 4 39|41}} 
| History                 = 
During the attempted Skrull conquest of Earth by [[Veranke (Earth-616)|Queen Veranke]], a massive Skrull army was deployed on Earth, large enough to occupy the planet.{{r|Secret Invasion Vol 1 1|8}} In the battle of San Francisco, two whole divisions were deployed against the [[X-Men (Earth-616)|X-Men]].{{r|Secret Invasion: X-Men Vol 1 1|3}} Skrull armies fought in the defense of Skrull worlds during the [[Infinity (Event)|Builders War]] and later participated in the liberation of those worlds occupied by the [[Builders (Race)|Builders]].{{r|Avengers Vol 5 18}}{{r|Infinity Vol 1 5}}{{r|Avengers Vol 5 21}}
| Notes                   = It is not clear if the Skrull Army is an independent armed service within the Skrull military or if it is a branch of the Skrull [[Skrull Imperial Starfleet (Earth-616)|Armada]]. During the Skrull invasion of Earth, it appeared to be subordinate to the fleet commanders.
